info.title: messages API
info.description: This is the messages API schema.

get.description:
GET /api/v1.0/config/
    Return a dictionary of public settings.

post.description:
Create or update a draft message.
    
    This endpoint allows you to:
    - Create a new draft message in a new thread
    - Create a draft reply to an existing message in an existing thread
    - Update an existing draft message
    
    For creating a new draft:
    - Do not include messageId
    - Include parentId if replying to an existing message
    
    For updating an existing draft:
    - Include messageId of the draft to update
    - Only the fields that are provided will be updated
    
    At least one of draftBody must be provided.

put.description:
Create or update a draft message.
    
    This endpoint allows you to:
    - Create a new draft message in a new thread
    - Create a draft reply to an existing message in an existing thread
    - Update an existing draft message

    - Do not include messageId
    - Include parentId if replying to an existing message
    
    For updating an existing draft:
    - Include messageId of the draft to update
    - Only the fields that are provided will be updated
    
    At least one of draftBody must be provided.

post.description: Change a specific flag (unread, starred, trashed) for multiple messages or all messages within multiple threads. Uses request body.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

schema.description: primary key for the record as UUID
primary key for the record as UUID

post.description: Check if recipient email addresses exist for the MTA.
Handle incoming raw email (message/rfc822) from MTA.

Send a previously created draft message.

    This endpoint finalizes and sends a message previously saved as a draft.
    The message content (subject, body, recipients) should be set when creating/updating the draft.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

get.description: Get aggregated statistics for threads based on filters.

parameters.name: has_sender
parameters.description: Filter threads with messages sent by the user (1=true, 0=false).

parameters.name: stats_fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of fields to aggregate (e.g., unread,messages,trashed).

get.description: Return information on currently logged user

message_ids.description: List of message UUIDs to apply the flag change to.

thread_ids.description: List of thread UUIDs where all messages should have the flag change applied.

id.description: primary key for the record as UUID

messageId.description: Message ID if updating an existing draft

parentId.description: Message ID if replying to an existing message

senderId.description: Mailbox ID to use as sender

draftBody.description: Content of the draft message as arbitrary text (usually JSON)

cc.description: List of CC recipient email addresses

bcc.description: List of BCC recipient email addresses

id.description: primary key for the record as UUID

Message.description:
Serialize messages, getting parsed details from the Message model.
Aligns field names with JMAP where appropriate (textBody, htmlBody, to, cc, bcc).

id.description: primary key for the record as UUID

thread.description: primary key for the record as UUID

created_at.title: Created on
created_at.description: date and time at which a record was created

updated_at.title: Updated on
updated_at.description: date and time at which a record was last updated

messageId.description: ID of the draft message to send

senderId.description: Mailbox ID from which to send (must match draft)

id.description: primary key for the record as UUID

updated_at.title: Updated on
updated_at.description: date and time at which a record was last updated

id.description: primary key for the record as UUID
